caller_intent: Andrea wants to change her last name on her home insurance policy to match her new name post-divorce (Andrea Aaronson), but is unsure of the process and needs guidance.
resolution_steps: Brandi explains that the name change requires documentation from the loan officer (e.g., refinance-related documents) to prove the name change.
Brandi offers to send Andrea a form to sign, which will be used to request the name change with the insurance company.
Brandi mentions that Universal Property and Casualty typically takes about two weeks to process such changes.
Brandi agrees to send Andrea an email with instructions and a document to sign, which Andrea can complete and return via email or text.
knowledge_required: Documentation requirements for updating policyholder information
Interaction with loan officers during refinance processes
Processing timelines for insurance companies (e.g., Universal Property and Casualty)
systems_referenced: Email communication (for sending documents and instructions)
summary: Andrea is updating her name post-divorce and needs to change her home insurance policy's last name to 'Aaronson.' Brandi explains the process requires documentation from her loan officer, a signed form, and a two-week processing time with the insurance carrier. Andrea will receive an email with instructions and can send the required documents via email or text.
